intro: Callisemaea elegans, commonly known as the California fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Callisemaea elegans is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
